thread.title: British man who died after row involving wet floor sign in Tenerife tourist spot was 'celebrating his birthday'
thread.title_full: British man who died after row involving wet floor sign in Tenerife tourist spot was 'celebrating his birthday'

author: mirror
title: British man who died after row involving wet floor sign in Tenerife tourist spot was 'celebrating his birthday'
text:
News British man who died after row involving wet floor sign in Tenerife tourist spot was 'celebrating his birthday' Another British national, 26, suffered a "slight facial trauma" during the incident with a 26-year-old and his wife held by Spanish police Share The brawl occurred in the district of Santiago del Teide, a resort about ten miles from the main tourist centre of Playa de las Americas, in Tenerife (stock photo) (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
A British man who died in hospital after suffering serious injuries in a brawl on Tenerife was celebrating his birthday in a hotel, according to police sources. 
The victim, 36, lost his battle for life this morning following the incident which happened at about midnight. 
It is understood he suffered a serious head injury in a fracas in the district of Puerto Santiago, a coastal resort about ten miles from the main tourist centre of Playa de las Americas. 
The town is not known for trouble. 
Another 26-year-old Brit is reported to have received slight facial injuries. A full investigation is currently underway to find out exactly what happened. 
It is not yet known if the two Brits were living on the island or on holiday but there are several hotels and apartments in the district. Map showing the district of Santiago del Teide on Tenerife Spanish wet floor sign (Photo: Rita Sobot) Read More British tourists injured in horror crash as bus plummets down steep hill and flips onto side in creek 
A full investigation is currently underway to find out exactly what happened. 
It is not yet known if the two Brits were living on the island or on holiday but there are hotels and apartments in the district. 
Spanish newspapers are reporting that the 26-year-old man has been arrested for a possible homicide offence and that his wife was also detained. 
They were being interviewed in the police station of Playa de las Americas Spanish newspaper La Opinion de Tenerife says the fight happened in an hotel where the victim and his wife were celebrating his birthday. 
A row was said to have broken out with another couple and it was during this that the yellow "floor wet" warning triangle was thrown in the direction of the 36-year-old husband. The fight then broke out. 
The emergency control centre in the Canary Islands received a call in the early hours of this morning to say there had been a fight or incident between two men in José González González street and that medics were urgently needed. 
Doctors treated both men at the scene and the 36-year-old was rushed to hospital where "he died as a result of severe head trauma." Tenerife (Photo: Getty) Read More Brit holidaymakers ignore Tunisian terror threat to rush out for deals starting at just £17 a night 
A spokesman for the 112 emergency service said: "The incident occurred around midnight, when the operating room of 1-1-2 received an alert that reported a brawl between two men in the street Jose Gonzalez Gonzalez and both had been injured and needed health care. 
"Once in place, SUC staff assisted the two affected, a 36-year-old man who died in hospital as a result of severe head trauma."La Opinion de Tenerife says the victim was lying in a pool of blood when the emergency services arrived. He died in hospital at about 3am. Like us on Facebook
